resources.string: Please enter your mobile number to receive a verification code and proceed with the test
What are the initial symptoms of COVID-19?
When should you consult a doctor?
What are the emergency signs of COVID-19?
Should I use soaps, hand-sanitizers or hand wash?

Symptoms for COVID-19 may appear from 2-14 days after exposure which conclude:
 · Fever
 · Cough
 · Shortness of breath or difficulty in breathing
 · Tiredness
 · Aches
 · Runny nose
 · Sore throat
If you have a travel history in the affected places or you are having those symptoms, you should immediately seek help from a professional.

If you are already a Coronavirus disease patient and you are not taking proper medical help, you may go into a critical condition with these signs: · Bluish face or eyes\n · Breathing difficulty\n · Chest pain
Yes, it is. The Coronavirus spread from person to person. This is why it is strictly prohibited to make physical contact with the affected patient.
Quarantine is a period of isolation. If you have initial symptoms of this virus you should keep yourself away from any kind of social gathering to find out if you are actually affected or not.
If you have symptoms of the illness or you are treating the patients with COVID-19, you should wear a mask.
You can use either soaps or hand wash. Wash your hands for 20 seconds. If you do not have any of these, you should rub your hand with hand-sanitizer that has 60% alcohol in it.
Invalid Phone Number. Please enter a valid phone number.
Invalid OTP. Please enter the 6 digits OTP.
Please give answer of all questions
Please check your phone and give your verification code below
I don\'t need stable relationship. What I need is a stable internet connection.

You are at minimum risk. You should follow instructions mentioned bellow:

• Avoid public gathering
• Avoid all unnecessary travel
•Avoid touching your face
•Practice respiratory hygiene
• Keep yourself at least 6ft away from other people
• Follow the preventive measures to stop the spread

You are ate average risk. You should follow instructions mentioned bellow:

• Stay home
• Avoid public gathering
• Stock up on food, supplies, and medication
• Keep yourself away from people & pets
• Frequently clean and disinfect your hands and living area
• Regularly monitor yourself for any symptoms
• Contact someone who will check in on you and help you if you get sick

You are ate high risk. You should follow instructions mentioned bellow:

• Contact IEDCR Bangladesh by phone if you are showing symptoms
• Stay home
• Prepare to be in quarantine for 2 to 4 weeks
• Prepare a separate room for stay
• Keep yourself away from people & pets
• Avoid sharing personal household items
• Cover your coughs and sneezes or wear a facemask
• Keep an eye on your health
• Call a doctor if symptoms worsen
• If you need to get medical care, avoid all public transportation
• Ask someone to bring you food and supplies

COVID 19, a viral infection disease that has recently been declared as pandemic by World Health Organization ( WHO ). This disease is the newly discovered Specie of CoronaVirus and as of now the scientists couldn’t invent the vaccine to cure. The spread occurs of this Flu virus through the respiratory droplet (cough and sneeze of people) and gradually the Respiratory system of infected people get damaged when it’s severe level and the patient suffer from breathing difficulty. And when the infected persons have a mild situation they experience cough, Fever, sore throat and runny nose as its symptoms.

Let’s try to understand how this idea of social distancing can flatten the infected curve with a simple simulation. Let\'s think there are 200 people in a city and one of them gets infected by COVID-19. All of them are moving around the city freely and thus affecting those who are around them in the process. These infected people are spreading the virus too. But if we can isolate 50 infected people, they lose the ability to get others infected. Thus the rate decreases and everyone gets disinfected as time goes by.
An update of tis app is available. Please update the app.
